title: a point on playing "support" role
body: THE point to playing support is to relativisticly get your "carry"/lane partner gold/ more gold then what the other "support" is getting their lane partner. There is more then one way to do this. I play bruiser support with a roaming & objective orientated map control. Ganks mid/dragons/warding & heavily ganking enemy jungle, especially in this patch, there are so many extra resources on the map (away from fountain). Smite support = free deward on bottom half of map taken from enemy wraiths (one example). Take resources from opponent team for yours. This type of play is far more dynamic (critical strategy), and diverse, as opposed to holding the ADC's hand in lane for 95% of the time. Its the same classification of arguement as a solo lane not being able to "win" (come out ahead) without jungle ganks/assistance. I play 1v2 bot lane as a bruiser with the enemy 2 having a camping jungle, effectively making it 1v3, and I pull my team out ahead more times then I don't. While adc goes to another lane with a support or second roaming jungle/variant. There is more then one style/way to skin a cat. People need to free themselves from what they atypically think of as "meta" (old rehashed strats from dota circa 2008).

Hey there D iddqd,

I admire your innovative take on the support role and I will definitely try this out since I main support. My personal play style for support is very aggressive. In all honesty, when I have an pre made ADC that I have developed a play style and strategic plans with I tend to play supports that have heavy poke and damage output. To put it in simple terms. I'm the one making all the plays and dealing all the damage. So that my ADC can focus on csing at a god like level and all he has to do is last hit the enemy champion. That's why I main champs like Thresh, Karma and Zyra. 

I honestly think Support is the most dynamic role in the game and that's why I love it. 

Supports for the win. < I'm sure Mirkinen will agree!
Regards,
